text: Get's the job done, -1 star since the buttons on GitHub are gone (new UI broke this extension?). Still able to clone via ssh/https by accessing the extension in the toolbar, just a couple more clicks than before.
It's ok, but it doesn't work with the recent new layout github preview and messes up the toolbar

It decides for you which IDE to open the file on, even lists IDEs that you might not have lol. I needed to see a file from a repo in pycharm which is the only one I have installed and listed others like webstorm, etc. Which I don't use neither have installed.

Doesn't work for me. Tried on Debian 11 and Ubuntu 22.04. Even though I allow the popup, there's absolutely no action. I also installed https://www.jetbrains.com/toolbox-app/ on Linux and run the Chrome extensio after it, but again it had no success in cloning anything.
Kind of useless because it's trying to guess the IDE for the repo and doesn't allow to choose a specific one, although it lists ones that I don't have

Great extension. I have only a little problem since on of the latest problems, where when you click a link on Bitbucket Server that does not actually reload the page, but only rewrites the current url, the icon in the Bitbucket toolbar will be added again, although it is already there. This happens for example when viewing a PR and changing between the included files.
it doesnt work for me(doesnt copy anything to my Webstorm - it just do nothing) (Windows10/Chrome)
Works great on my company's self-hosted Gitlab. Highly recommend!

I LOVE IT

Doesn't wanna open pycharm project only the java based one, i have .idea included, just let us tick boxes mb?

edit: Fixed

I've been reading some of the reviews and, while the Toolbox *has* needed a lot of changes/improvements/new features to make it useful (that's to be expected with any developing product), it was Marina's quick response and immediate fixes that impressed me most. That's enough to make me want to see how well the Toolbox matures. Good job Marina!
SuperB, i except nothing less from the JetBrains team.
Awesome!

Neat idea (pun absolutely intended)! However it looks like it doesn't detect Android Studio compatible projects as such. It just offers IntelliJ IDEA instead of Android Studio. Random sample project for you to verify: https://github.com/diogobernardino/WilliamChart

I'm a big fan of JetBrains toolbox, but sadly I have yet to click one of these buttons. Issues

1) Support Enterprise GIthub, GItlab, other repos.
2) Support other branches
3) Support 1-click automatic selection of location of project through the style that Golang or https://github.com/motemen/ghq do (set a $FOLDER and  then it's set to $FOLDER/domain/repo seperated by slashes.
4) Support forks - automatically setting upstream, etc

Right now it's faster to open a terminal and type 'ghq get R... Show more
